body: We'd need the complete stacktrace to figure out what went wrong.

Received args: --upgrade-mod 20160508
System.NullReferenceException: An object reference is not set to an instance of the object。
   在 OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.UpgradeRules.UpgradeActorRules(ModData modData, Int32 engineVersion, List`1& nodes, MiniYamlNode parent, Int32 depth)
   In OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.UpgradeRules.UpgradeActorRules(ModData modData, Int32 engineVersion, List`1& nodes, MiniYamlNode parent, Int32 depth)
   In OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.UpgradeRules.UpgradeActorRules(ModData modData, Int32 engineVersion, List`1& nodes, MiniYamlNode parent, Int32 depth)
   In OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.UpgradeModCommand.ProcessYaml(String type, IEnumerable`1 files, ModData modData, Int32 engineDate, UpgradeAction processFile)
   In OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.UpgradeModCommand.OpenRA.IUtilityCommand.Run(Utility utility, String[] args)
   In OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) position c:\Repository\OpenRA\OpenRA.Utility\Program.cs:line 97

20160508 is almost certainly wrong, and will make the updater do unexpected things.  You need to give it the date that the rules actually target, which I assume will be sometime in October - December.
But which date i should give?
The RA2 mod doesn't document the engine date that it targets, so you'll have to work it out based on commit dates and trial and error (look for the last merged PR that updates engine compatibility).

I checked, last merged PR is 20170101, i tried this date, still error:

@cookgreen i think pchote mean that you need the date of the lastest working version of openra on that ra2 worked before it get broken with changes in openra master.

@cookgreen You shoulda sit down and figure out things on your own. The last upgrade rule applied to the RA2 mod would be the AttackSequence->DefaultAttackSequence rule IIRC, but tbh at this point it'll probably need someone with at least the level of an experienced modder to get it up'n'running again due to the upgrade->conditions rules and pretty sure not every one of them gets converted automatically. I don't have time to push someone to that level currently nor I have the intention to tutor you, due to my previous explaining attempts constantly falling flat.
so what will me do? fix the yaml files myself? or just wait your guys fix?
